https://github.com/godotengine/godot/issues/3226
https://github.com/godotengine/godot/issues/7416

data.title: Icons
Add parameters to Directory.list_dir_begin() to skip navigational or hidden entries
data.body:
Implements https://github.com/godotengine/godot/issues/7320

Now PR'd without unmergeable stuff... =S

I added the following two parameters to `_Directory::list_dir_begin`:
- `skip_navigational`: When `true`, iterating through the directory does not return the `.` and `..` directories.
- `skip_hidden`: When `true`, iterating through the directory does not return hidden subdirectories and files (as defined by `DirAccess::current_is_hidden()`).

I'm a bit unsure about the "navigational" parameter name. Maybe someone knows a better term for it.

data.title: Make image-groups map in export.cfg ordered
data.body: This improves the VCS experience because otherwise they change their order everytime producing spurious changes.

data.title: Cherry-pick usability fixes in web export presentation
data.body:
Some fixes for the most annoying stuff

 - Make canvas support check message visible
 - Make it a little more obvious status can be closed by clicking
 - Don't use status to display non-critical errors
 - Fix setting total memory

data.title: Fix crash when creating new project
data.body:
it's caused by #7525 and fix #7555

and these results are same as described at #7527
```gdscript
print("".plus_file("file"))  # prints "file"
print("/".plus_file("file"))  # prints "/file"
print("whatever".plus_file("/usr").plus_file("bin"))  # prints "whatever/user/bin"
```

data.title: Patch for trackpad scrolling on Mac
data.body:
#### Related to https://github.com/godotengine/godot/issues/492 and https://github.com/godotengine/godot/issues/3913

This is a quick patch for scrolling with trackpad on Mac (was way too fast). It is **not intended** as a permanent solution, but it is working well enough for me now and also provides a starting point if anyone else wants to continue on these issues. =]

It does **NOT** fix the slow horizontal scrolling in the editor - the editor also seems to still scroll faster vertically than other components, but it is still inherently better with the patch.

This was tested on an older 15" MBP without retina display - **I am building/testing on the 2.1 branch**

data.title: Fix gibberish output for windows/mingw.
data.body:
`%ls` should be used instead of `%s` or `%S` to speficy narrow/wide charstring
in `wprintf` `fwprintf`

Fixes #6252

data.title: Make image-groups map in export.cfg ordered (2.1)
data.body: This improves the VCS experience because otherwise they change their order everytime producing spurious changes.

data.title: Running a scene/game from the editor makes the game crash after one frame
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Arch Linux 64 Bit, current master


**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
When trying to run a scene or the whole project from the editor the game crashes after one frame.

`_ready()` run fine and `_process()` runs once. After that the window just closes without further information.

Running the project from a terminal works just fine.


**Steps to reproduce:**
Open a project in the editor and try to run it.
Try to run a scene from the editor.
Try to do the same but from a terminal.

**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):
[test.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/708951/test.zip)

data.title: will godot 3 require OpenGl 3.3?
data.body:
Trying to run the latest godot build from git, I get the following error message, followed by a segfault:

`WARNING: not found: display/window/allow_hidpi
ERROR: initialize: Could not obtain an OpenGL 3.3 context!
   At: platform/x11/context_gl_x11.cpp:160.
ERROR: initialize: Error initializing GLAD
   At: drivers/gles3/rasterizer_gles3.cpp:136.
[1]    16661 segmentation fault (core dumped)  godot
`
I run godot on an old laptop with an intel gpu that does only supports gl version 2.1. Can I assume that with the latest changes to the renderer, older hardware will not be supported anymore and godot will require at least OpenGl 3.3 or is this just a bug, that will be fixed in the future?

data.title: Style: Add .clang-format based on LLVM style
data.body:
Adapted some parameters to fit the de facto Godot style as closely as possible
(tab indentation, long lines with no wrapping - for now -, indented case labels,
left-aligned pointer operators).

------

**Note:** This commit does not reformat the code base, it only adds the `.clang-format` style configuration file. Please review it and try it locally as you'll soon need to have clang-format properly setup.

You can see here (slightly outdated) examples of how the code base will change once I apply our style to all our C++ files: https://github.com/akien-mga/godot/commits/clang-format2

About the chosen style: Feel free to comment about the choices made, but keep in mind that we want the changes to be the least intrusive possible in the first place. This style is basically the same as the existing *de facto* style of @reduz, with some consensual changes such as adding spaces around operators.
So please, no holy war about brackets style and whatnot :)

data.title: Can't connect to asset library on Windows 7 in 2.1 branch
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Windows 7 x64

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
Trying to access the asset library fails, a blank panel is opened with an error message at the bottom:

> Can't connect to host: https://godotengine.org/asset-library/api

Same happens for 'Templates' in the project manager.

**Steps to reproduce:**
1. Open a project in Godot's editor
2. Open the asset library
3. Error message `Can't connect to host: https://godotengine.org/asset-library/api` appears at the bottom

ping @Faless maybe related to your cherry picks?

data.title: Remote debugger not working on Windows
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**

Godot.64bit  2.1 branch (9c8ecb45f8516a2)
compiled on Windows 7 with MinGW-w64, 4.8.3

**Issue description**:

gdscript remote debugger cannot connect to editor:

```
Remote Debugger: Connection failed with status: 3'', retrying in 1 sec.
Remote Debugger: Connection failed with status: 3'', retrying in 1 sec.
Remote Debugger: Connection failed with status: 3'', retrying in 1 sec.
Remote Debugger: Unable to connect
```

Reverting IPv6 commits enables the debugger connection again.
Local debugger is working.
I have nothing configured for IPv6 support and never used it with Windows 7.

**Related issue**
#7545

data.title: Limit maximum width of editor settings popup
data.body:
This is a quick "fix" to https://github.com/godotengine/godot/issues/6437

Settings popups were incredibly wide since they were simply opened with a ratio relative to the editor windows size. I kept that ratio, but limited the width to 800 editor units (it felt like a nice trade off between lengthy property values and trackability of them back to their names).

Applies to project and editor settings popups.

Before:
![before](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/9631152/21964664/b82279ce-db50-11e6-8c4d-0938ae675b19.png)

After:
![after](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/9631152/21964665/b944d0c2-db50-11e6-9396-d0dd84e3a2bb.png)

data.body:
Implements https://github.com/godotengine/godot/issues/7320

I added the following two parameters to `_Directory::list_dir_begin`:
- `skip_navigational`: When `true`, iterating through the directory does not return the `.` and `..` directories.
- `skip_hidden`: When `true`, iterating through the directory does not return hidden subdirectories and files (as defined by `DirAccess::current_is_hidden()`).

I'm a bit unsure about the "navigational" parameter name. Maybe someone knows a better term for it.

data.title: Export with custom serializers/deserializers
data.body:
This is a feature suggestion.

There should be a way to give custom (de)serialization code for the export of a variable. E.g. something like
```
export(ser_foo, deser_foo) foo = SomeClass()

func ser_foo(foo_thing):
    return doSomething(foo_thing) # Something that returns a string

func deser_foo(str):
    return doSomethingElse(str) # Something that returns a valid value for foo
```

It might be useful to parameterize also on the export type, but just exporting custom exports as strings would cover the majority of uses, I would guess.

I can think of a couple potential uses:
 - If exported to a human-readable format, could allow easier modification from the editor.
 - It would allow the saving of ordinarily non-exportable values when packing scenes, for example when unloading an area in an open-world game.

data.title: Can't change y coordinate of a group of objects in the scene tree without changing x coordinate also
data.body:
I'm not sure if this is a bug or a feature request.

If I have a group of objects selected in the scene tree and I change only the Y coordinate of them in the inspector, all the selected objects end up at the same X and Y coordinates (ie. overlapping each other).
I would like to be able to select a group of objects and modify just their Y (or X, or Z) coordinate in isolation of modifying the coordinates on the other axes.
eg. If I have 2D objects at {10,10}, {20,20} and {30,30}, I'd like to be able to select all of them in the scene tree, type "10" in the Y Transform Position, and have the objects at {10,10}, {20,10} and {30,10}. Currently all 3 objects will end up at {10,10}.

data.title: Feature request : Icon tooltips in scene tree to reflect the icons meaning
data.body:
Currently if I highlight any of the icons in the scene tree, the tooltip says "Instance: res://[xyz].tscn Type: [abc]"
These two screenshots (in my opinion) shouldn't show the same tooltip.
![shot1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5151242/21962263/aec62f0e-db75-11e6-8b05-05e050e0c6aa.png)

![shot2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5151242/21962276/03cd3970-db76-11e6-8a18-f33517de906f.png)

I would like to request that this is changed (particularly as I can't find in the documentation a guide as to what the icons mean), so that each icons tooltip explains the icon the mouse is hovering over.

eg. Hovering over the eye icon would say "Toggle Visibility". Hovering over the group icon would say "Group: [whatever the group name is]" etc.
